title: How to start your own Bison herd!

subtasks: Considering local resources and contacts for bison.
Ensuring proper facilities and fencing for bison.
Gathering experience or knowledge of livestock farming.
Contacting local bison breeders or associations for guidance.
Understanding the unique aspects of bison behavior and handling.
Visiting existing bison farms to observe operations and procedures.
Maintaining property with suitable grazing conditions.
Staying informed through bison associations and resources.

tasks.task: Addressing viewer questions and encouraging bison farming.
subtasks: Responding to inquiries about permits and licenses.
Sharing personal experience and encouragement for bison farming.
Engaging with viewers via social media and website.
